text: The arrondissement of Limoux is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Aude département in the Occitanie region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Limoux. ==History== When the Aude department was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Limoux was part of that original department. ==Geography== It is the southernmost of the arrondissements of the department, with an area of , with a population of 44,467 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement of Limoux is bordered to the north and east by the arrondissement of Carcassonne, to the south by the Pyrénées-Orientales department, and to the west by the Ariège department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Limoux, there are 2 cantons whose communes are in the arrondissement and 2 that has some of its "communes" in other "arrondissements", as can be seen in the following table: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Limoux INSEE code Canton Carcassonne Limoux Narbonne Total 1101 La Piège au Razès 46 26 72 1103 Carcassonne-2 6 + part of Carcassonne 2 8 + part of Carcassonne 1109 Région-Limouxine 35 35 1114 La Haute-Vallée de l'Aude 84 84 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Limoux has 147 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
